intro: Enneapogon lindleyanus, commonly known as the slender grass or wild millet, is a flowering plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas and is adapted to dry or semi-arid conditions. Its seeds are often used as a food source by both wildlife and humans in some regions. The botanical features of Enneapogon lindleyanus make it an important species in ecological and agricultural contexts.
